description: Basic Package - Specifies boundary conditions, initial heads, and certain output control options

variables.name: COMMENT
variables.description: Optional comment lines at beginning of file.
variables.tooltip: Lines starting with '#' are treated as comments and ignored by MODFLOW.

variables.name: FREE
variables.description: Indicates free-format input for all packages.
variables.tooltip: When specified, all input data is read in free format. Strongly recommended for new models.

variables.name: XSECTION
variables.description: Indicates the model is a cross-section with a single row.
variables.tooltip: Used for 2D cross-section models where NROW=1. Adjusts internal boundary handling.

variables.name: CHTOCH
variables.description: Indicates that flow between adjacent constant-head cells should be calculated.
variables.tooltip: By default, flow between two adjacent constant-head cells is not calculated. This option enables it.

variables.name: PRINTTIME
variables.description: Indicates that simulation start and end times should be printed to listing file.
variables.tooltip: Prints the start time, end time, and elapsed time at the end of the listing file.

variables.name: SHOWPROGRESS
variables.description: Indicates that simulation progress should be displayed.
variables.tooltip: Displays simulation progress during execution. Useful for long-running simulations.

variables.name: IBOUND
variables.description: Boundary condition array for each layer. >0=active variable-head, 0=inactive no-flow, <0=constant head.
variables.tooltip: Defines cell status: positive values indicate active cells (head computed), zero indicates no-flow cells, negative values indicate constant-head cells. Read for each layer.

datasets.description: Head value assigned to inactive cells

variables.name: HNOFLO
variables.description: Head value assigned to inactive (no-flow) cells.
variables.tooltip: Value of head written for inactive cells in output. Common values: -999.99, -9999, or 0. Used only for output display.

variables.name: STRT
variables.description: Starting head at the beginning of the simulation for each cell.
variables.tooltip: Initial heads for each cell. For steady-state simulations, these serve as initial guesses for the solver. For transient runs, these are the heads at time=0. Read for each layer.
